page.title: 13THE MILKMAN
page.content: The owner of Rosebank Dairy,in Ainsdale,gets up at 5AM,six days a week.After a light breakfast he goes out to load the vans with the various crates of milk,eggs,cream etc.At 6AM he is ready to leave and he waits with his son for the helper boys to arrive.The boys work from about 6.15 until 7.30AM when they then get ready for school. The first round ends about 8.45AM when they return to the dairy to unload the empty bottles and prepare for the second round before going in to breakfast.The second round lasts from 9.30 untill 11AM.The milk deliveries are recorded into an account book.At the end of the week the money is totalled. Despite the pressure from supermarkets there is still a future for door step deliveries,to many old people the milkman is a valued friend
